alert.note: Alert for South Central Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: High Wind Warning issued February 21 at 6:51PM MST until February 23 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MST THURSDAY... ...WIND ADVISORY WILL EXPIRE AT 7 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Southwest winds 40 to 60 mph with gusts of 75 to 85 mph. * WHERE...South Central Mountains. * WHEN...Until 5 AM MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Damaging winds will blow down trees and power lines. Damage may occur to mobile homes, roofs, sheds, barns, outbuildings, and fences. Widespread power outages are expected. Travel will be very difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. Areas of blowing dust may reduce visibility below 1/2 mile at times. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A period of heavy snow and blowing snow may produce very low visibility Wednesday in the higher terrain around Ruidoso. Several inches of snow are possible with blizzard-like conditions and slick travel.
info.instruction: Take action to secure trash cans, lawn furniture, and other loose or lightweight outdoor objects. Extremely hazardous driving conditions can be expected, especially for motorists in high profile vehicles who should consider delaying travel.
